title.narrative: Provision of food assistance, emergency medical care and livelihood support to migrants in Djibouti

description.narrative:
Overall objective: Follow-up the migrants who left Yemen because of the war and who are in a situation of vulnerability in Djibouti. The migrants are from various nationalities : Yemenite, Ethiopian, Somali and others.
Specific objective: 1. Provide an emergency medical care to the migrants in conditions of extreme poverty 2. Support the migrants families and the women with a food assistance 3. Make the migrants be economically autonomous thanks to the projects of microcredit
Profile of beneficiaries: The number of beneficiaries is around 530 (cumulated number) and 210 if we rely to the number of participations to the training courses. This number concerns: - 7 families (male beneficiaries), so to say more or less 49 people, concerning the project of microcredit; - 23 families (female beneficiaries), so to say more or less 161 people, concerning the project of professional training (sewing and hairstyling); - 170 sick people receiving a medical assistance; - 150 families receiving food assistance.
The profile of the beneficiary is : 1. Being migrant, refugee or displaced in a situation of vulnerability and coming from Yemen. 2. Being a mother or a father in a situation of vulnerability. 3. Not being able to support him/herself for basic needs.
